text_value:
THE UNIVERSITY OF MELBOURNE ARCHIVES
NAME OF COLLECTION
Lewis, Orr & Gibson
ACCESSION NO 1962.0001
CATEGORY Business, organisations
ACTIVITY Lawyers
DATE RANGE 1837-1952
SIZE OF COLLECTION 4 m. (29 archive boxes)
HISTORICAL NOTE Lewis, Orr and Gibson's lineage goes back to the earliest days of the Port Phillip settlement when R.E. Lewis joined K.E. Brodribb and Thomas Crisp's legal partnership in 1860. Subsequent partners included Henry Hedderwick, W.J. Fookes and Lewis' son, R.R. Lewis. Their clients included many early Melbourne notables and businesses and many large landowners throughout Victoria and New South Wales.
DATE OF TRANSFER March, 1962
ACCESS CONDITIONS Open
DESCRIPTION Legal documents and some accompanying correspondence, 1837-1952; some business and family documents (along with numerous legal documents) of James G. Robertson and family of Mt. Mitchell and other estates.
NOTE ON COLLECTIONS
NOTE ON LISTING
LISTED BY Susan Priestley DATE October, 1962
LISTED BY Frank Strahan DATE July, 1962

R. E. LEWIS, ORR & GIBSON.
406 Lonsdale Street, Melbourne, C.1.
Solicitors.
March 1962.
Sands & McDougall's (formerly Sands & Kenny's) Melbourne Directories give the following information:
1857: Robert E. Lewis, solicitor, listed at 192 Napier-st., Collingwood. Edw. Ladner, storekeeper, at same address.
1858: Address 50 Napier-st, with Letchford & Raper, aerated water manufacturers and wine and spirit merchants.
1859: Address 144 Napier-st., between Condell and Moor Sts. Described as notary public.
1860: Above address and of Brodribb, Crisp & Lewis, solicitors, 51 Little Collins-st., west. Note: K.E. Brodribb listed in 1855 Directory. In 18? (1856 missing) the firm is Brodribb & Crisp.
1866: Private address listed as Victoria Pde., Fitzroy.
1867: Firm becomes Crisp & Lewis, 51 Chancery Lane (= Lit. Collins St.).
1868: Private address Barry-st., Carlton.
1870: Firm becomes Crisp, Lewis & Wilkes. (John Wilkes is new partner).
1871: R.E. Lewis noted as absent in England.
1874: Private address is Malvern-lodge, Malvern.
1875: Firm again becomes Crisp & Lewis.
1877: Firm becomes Crisp, Lewis & Hedderwick at 41 & 43 Queen St. Henry Hedderwick new partner.
1881: Missing.
1882: Firm at 51 & 53 Lit. Collins-st., west.
1884: Name of firm the same, but W.J. Fookes taken into partnership.
1886: Private residence at Dickens-st., St. Kilda.
1889: Firm at 414 Lit. Collins-st.
1890: Thos. Crisp no longer in partnership. Lewis' private residence St. James' Park, Shakespeare Grove, Hawthorn.
1901: Firm becomes Lewis, Hedderwick & Fookes, with R.E. Lewis jnr. in partnership.
1907: Firm becomes R.E. Lewis & Son, still at 414 Lit. Collins Street.
1928: Firm becomes Lewis, R.E. & Beacham Kiddle.
1937: Firm becomes R.E. Lewis.

1938: Firm becomes R.E. Lewis & Son.
1942: Change of address to 318 Collins St.
1943: Change to 379 Collins St.
1957: Firm becomes R.E. Lewis, Orr & Gibson. Partners are Radcliffe Lewis, Wm. G. Orr and J.S. Gibson.
1959: Address changes to 406 Lonsdale St. in March.
---0000000---
LIST OF RECORDS
Note: The records are listed in alphabetical order according to the name of the firm's client. Whenever it has survived, the filing number of the firm is recorded after the quantity description of the document. It seems probable that there are several series of these filing numbers, but it was not possible to differentiate between them. A comprehensive index of all parties to the documents and places mentioned therein will be found at the end of the list of records.

A 'BECKETT, Thomas Turner.
Bond.
William Arthur Callender A'BECKETT to Thomas George Washington Johnston ROBINSON, both of Melbourne. a'Beckett to pay annuity in return for title to allot. 3, section 4, and part of allot. 8, sect.20, City of Melbourne. T.T. a'Beckett and Theyre Weigall to be trustees.
1860, 17 Dec.
1 sheet. 1802.

ACME CYCLE COMPANY
Dissolution of Partnership.
Sydney Wm. Annand DARBY, Melbourne, importer and Frank BENNETT, Melbourne, importer.
Firm of Acme Cycle Co. to be dissolved on 31 Dec. 1914.
1914, 24 Dec.
4 sheets. 898.

ADAMS, Alexander James.
Probate with Will.
Wife Adah Emilie Adams (later Sherwood) to be executrix and beneficiary.
1894, 2 June
2 sheets. 10173.

ADAMS, Josiah Enos.
Mortgage.
Wm. Henry FISH and Henry WRATTEN, both of Bushy Park Farm, Mulgrave, farmers to J.E. ADAMS, S. Yarra, gentleman.
Stock and chattels of farm; inventory included.
1881, 12 Dec.
3 sheets. 3509.

series_notes_value: Note: Documents listed below refer to a piece of land, 96 acres being portion 23A, parish of Prahran, co. Bourke.
text_value:
ADAMS & FISH
Note: Documents listed below refer to a piece of land, 96 acres being portion 23A, parish of Prahran, co. Bourke.
(1) Grant by Purchase.
Matthew NEAVE.
1849, 20 Oct.
4 sheets.
(2) Mortgage.
Matthew NEAVE, Melb., licensed victualler, to Thos. RITCHIE, Scone V.D.L., gent.
1850, 8 April.
11 sheets.
(3) Release from Mortgage.
Rev. Robt. RUSSELL, Evandale, V.D.L., minister of Presbyterian Church; Richard Helen McKENZIE, Launceston, merchant; Wm. GIBSON, Eskdale, V.D.L., gent.; all executors of Thos. Ritchie to Matthew NEAVE.
1852, 6 Feb.
7 sheets.
(4) Result of search re Monk deceased.
Gives account of how land came into possession of Alfred MONK.
1875, 7 June.
7 sheets.
(5) Bills of Costs, Frederick BAYNE, 64 Chancery Lane to Mrs. Monk.
For legal advice re sale of property in Prahran.
1856, Feb. - Aug.
2 sheets.
(6) Bill of Costs, W.C.C. HUMPHREYS to James MONK'S administrators.
1853, Apl. - Dec.
1 sheet.
(7) Letters of Administration.
Estate of James MONK, Melb., shoemaker to wife Elizabeth.
1853, 5 May.
1 sheet.
(8) Receipts from Gardiner District Road Board for rates assessed on properties described as "wood cottage", "house and land","houses and land".
1857 - 1860.
7 sheets.
(9) Papers relating to lease of land and cottage, Alfred MONK to Thos. STOKES.
1868 - 1871.
3 sheets.
(10) Letter, Geo. CULLEN, 13 Swanston St., Melb. to Alfred MONK.
Requests title deed to land on behalf of Thos. Stokes.
30 Sept. 1870.
1 sheet.
Note: Filing number of above appears to be 1806. Although no envelope found, the name "Adams & Fish" is found on several documents.

ADAMSON, William.
Note: Filing numbers are 1799 and 1800.
(1) Award of Arbitrators.
Robt. WALKER, grocer; Geo. Thompson BAID, gent.; and John BENN, merchant; all of Melbourne.
In dissolution of partnership of James Farquharson McKENZIE and Robt. HARPER, coffee roasters, Lygon St., Melbourne.
1860, 16 June.
4 sheets.
(2) Deed of Assignment and Dissolution of Partnership.
Harper and McKenzie.
Includes schedules of effects of their coffee roasting and general grinding business.
1860, 13 Aug.
4 sheets.
(3) Assignment of Lease.
Harper to McKenzie.
Allot. 6, Sect. 17, fronting Lygon St., parish of Jika Jika, co. Bourke.
1860, 13 Aug.
3 sheets.
(4) Assignment of leaseholds, goods and chattels.
McKenzie to Harper.
Grinders etc., and property leased from Frederick Griffin.
1860, 14 Aug.
4 sheets.
Re-assignment. Harper to McKenzie. Goods and leases of (4) above. 1860, 17 Dec. 1 sheet.
Mortgage. McKenzie to Wm. ADAMSON, Melb., seedsman. £500 on allot. 6, sect. 17 (see 3 above), and equipment of coffee-grinding business. 1861, 14 Feb. 4 sheets.

Deed of Settlement. McKenzie to Adamson. £350 to be settled on Robt. Harper the younger. Adamson to be trustee until Harper is of age. Includes also conclusion of trust 18 March 1863. 1861, 8 Nov. 1 sheet.
Power of Attorney. McKenzie to Adamson, or him failing, Robt. Walker, Melb., grocer. During a short absence from colony. 1861, 8 Nov. 3 sheets.
Declaration. Mrs. Robt. Harper re date of her marriage and birth of son. 1863, 5 Feb. 1 sheet.
Power of Attorney. Farquharson SMITH to Wm. ADAMSON. 1863, 13 Feb. 1 sheet.

License to use Patent. McKenzie to firm Messrs. J.F. McKenzie & Co. Re an invention "for Improvements in Roasting Coffee and other Seeds and Roots and also in drying grain". 1863, 2 April. 1 sheet (in duplicate).

Articles of Partnership. J.F. McKenzie, Wm. Adamson and Robt. Harper jnr. Coffee roasting business of J.F. McKenzie & Co., 3 Queen St., Melb. Capital £6000. 1863, 2 April. 7 sheets Note: Incorporates also 13 below.
Additional Agreement. Substitutes Geo. Miller, McKenzie's brother-in-law, for McKenzie who is to retire because of ill-health. 1864, 20 Dec. 2 sheets, incorporated in 12 above.
Notes, memos re above deeds 11 to 13. 1861-3. 5 sheets.
Declaration. Wm. THOMPSON, M.D., to effect that paralysis prevents McKenzie from writing. 1866, 6 July. 1 sheet.

Assignment of lease. Geo. MILLER and Wm. ADAMSON, coffee roasters, Melb. to Wm. PETERSON, John Scott PETERSON, both merchants, and Robert SMITH, coffee roaster, all of Melbourne. Part of allot. 8, sect. 3, City of Melb., and buildings thereon. 1867, 4 March. 2 sheets.
Assignment of Patent. Wm. ADAMSON to Messrs. PETERSON and SMITH. Patent is same as in 11 above. 1867, 5 March. 1 sheet.

Lease. Wm. ADAMSON, seedsman, Melb. to Thos. BRUNTON, Melb., merchant; Alexander RUSSELL, Malmesbury, engineer; and Alexander GILLESPIE, Melbourne, miller. Allot 21, sect. 1, City of Melb. Includes corner Lit. Flinders and Spencer Sts., with consent of mortgagees, Sir Jas. Frederick PALMER, Sir Francis MURPHY, and Hon. James HENTY. 1869, 20 May. 3 sheets.

AFFLECK, James. Release from mortgage and Re-assignment. James AFFLECK, Kybybotite, W. Wimmera District to James FLETCHER, late of Pleasant Banks station, now of Green Mount nr. Portland, executor of will of Wm. AFFLECK, late of Pleasant Banks, squatter. Mortgage had been stock on Pleasant Banks and certain goods and chattels. 1867, 22 June. 1 sheet, 1987. Note: See also 263/1/17.

ALLISON, Joseph, and brothers. (1) Deed of Partnership. Joseph, Thos. Herbert and Albert Henry ALLISON, all of Melb. To carry on business of Undertakers and Funeral Directors, at North Melbourne and Moonee Ponds. 1917, 4 Sept. 4 sheets. 1075.
Certificate of Registration. Firm as above. 1917, 6 Sept. 1 sheet. 1075.

ALLISON, Henry. Mortgage. Edw. Wm. ALLISON to Henry ALLISON. Edw. Wm. is a builder at Springhill and Henry is an undertaker at Melbourne. £200 on lot ?20, parish of Springhill, county Talbot. 1864, 20 April. 1 sheet. 1815.
ANDERSON, Francis. Covenant to produce power of attorney. Thos. MILLER, Melb., gent. with Francis ANDERSON. 1855, 9 April. 1 sheet. 1803.

ANDREWS' ESTATE. (1) Marriage settlement. Capt. F.E. APPLEYARD, Naval and Military Club, Westminster to Miss Louisa ANDREW, Bayswater, England. Settlement by Mrs. Louisa FOWLER (formerly Mrs. ANDREW) of ½ share of land in Melb., being allot. 13, sect. 4, partly bounded by Collins St., this being land settled on her on her marriage with Alexander ANDREW Esq. deceased. 1855, 7 Dec. 5 sheets. 12451.

Ditto. Capt. Henry Rushworth WRANISLAW, R.N., Rugby with Mary Ann ANDREW, Thames Ditton, England. Same provision as for Louisa (see 1 above). 1870, 19 July. 6 sheets. 12451. Note: Nos. 3 to 8 below refer to piece of land, allot. 13, sect. 4.
Grant by Purchase. Thos. HOOD, Melbourne. 1838, 10 March. 2 sheets. 12451.
Re-Lease. Thos. HOOD, Melbourne, yeoman to Jonathan CLERKE, M.D., Melb. Note: Re-leases are virtually sales. 1837, 18 Sept. 2 sheets. 12451.
Ditto. Jonathan CLERKE by the direction of Robt. REEVES, merchant to David PATRICK, M.D. and Wm. HIGHETT, trustee, all of Melbourne. 1839, 14-15 Oct. 2 sheets.
Ditto. David PATRICK, Cathkin, Goulburn River to George LILLY, auctioneer, and Wm. EMPSON, linen draper, Melbourne. 1840, 24 Oct. 2 sheets.
Mortgage. Geo. LILLY to David PATRICK. 1840, 27 Oct. 2 sheets.
Transfer of Mortgage. David PATRICK to John Moffatt CHISHOLM, merchant, Melbourne. 1842, 22 and 24 Jan. 4 sheets.
Conveyance of the Equity of Redemption. Geo. LILLY, and his trustee John Pascoe FAWKNER to John Moffatt CHISHOLM, trustee for James PURVES, all of Melbourne. 1842, 9 May. 2 sheets.
Declaration of Lewis WINCKWORTH. As to present trustees of the marriage settlement (2) above. 1904, 24 June. 4 sheets.
Declaration of Frederick Ernst APPLEYARD. As to his being the sole surviving trustee of the marriage settlement (1) above. 1904, 28 June. 4 sheets.

Scrip certificates for shares in The Great Dargo Flat Bucket Gold Dredging Syndicate, Dargo River, Gippsland. Issued to M. Melvin. Marked "Received as security for rent from Isaacs, 24 July 1908". 6 sheets. 329.
Memorandum of Terms of Settlement. Sydney ISAACS with Appleyard and others v. R.E. LEWIS. 1908, 1 July. 357. 4 sheets.
Surrender and Indemnity, Refers to (13) above. 1908, 11 July. 1 sheet. 357.
Statutory Declaration. By Isaacs. Refers to (13) above. 1908, 11 July. 1 sheet. 357.

ARMSTRONG, John. (1) Agreement. John ARMSTRONG, George MARSHALL and Abiel Meshelemiah Joseph SAVILL, all of Melbourne. Armstrong transfers his interest in Cosgrave's Hotel, Swanston St., Melbourne to Savill with Marshall's acquiescence. 1861, 10 Sept. 2 sheets. 1710.
Letter, Charles BROWN, lessor of Cosgrave's Hotel, to Armstrong and Savill. Agrees to substitution of Savill in lease. 1861, 10 Sept. 1 sheet. 1710.
Rough draft of (1) above. 1861, 6 Sept. 1 sheet. 1710.

ARNOLD & SHEEHY. Conveyance and assignment for the benefit of creditors. Albert George ARNOLD and Peter Francis SHEEHY, chemists and druggists, 104 Bourke St. east, Melbourne to John R. DUERDIN and Frederick HEMMONS, wholesale druggists, and other creditors. 1878, 16 Feb. 8 sheets. 2428.
